body.name: SmallRig 78" Camera Tripod, Foldable Aluminum Tripod & Monopod, 360°Ball Head Detachable and Quick Release Plate, Payload 33lb, Adjustable Height from 18.5" to 78" for Camera, Phone - 3474C
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 10 hrs 41 mins
features: COMPATIBILITY: This tripod camera is universally compatible with all cameras and equipment with 1/4"-20 and 3/8"-16 threaded holes, such as DSLR cameras, sports cameras, and mirrorless cameras. It can also be used with mobile phones and projectors. Note: For cameras with a telephoto zoom lens, you will need to purchase a tripod mount ring or telephoto lens bracket for better balance.

2-IN-1 TRIPOD & MONOPOD: The aluminium tripod can be easily transformed into a monopod or walking stick, making it an ideal companion for hiking or travelling. The central pole can be inverted to allow for low-angle shooting and macro photography. The 4-section column legs with 3 quick-release flip-locks allow you to adjust the working height from 18.5" to 78.7" in seconds. The folded 19.6" of size makes it easy to take anywhere for outdoor photography.

36MM BALL-HEAD: Compared to other ball heads with a diameter of less than 36mm (for example, 28mm,22mm), a 36mm head can provide better stability. The specially designed 36mm metal ball head can rotate 360°, allowing you to take photos at any angle horizontally and vertically. Additionally, the ball head of the tripod is detachable, thanks to the double-headed screw design on the top of the tripod, making the panoramic tripod compatible with 1/4"-20 and threaded holes ball head or fluid head.

33LBS MAX LOAD: The DSLR tripod offers a high level of stability using a high-quality magnesium aluminum alloy. It can withstand up to 33 lbs (15 kg). You can focus on composition and be ready for your photo or video without worrying that your hand may be shaky. The weight of the tripod is 3.46 lbs, and the lightweight tripod comes with a carry bag, so you can easily take it anywhere you want to go.

INNOVATION and PACKAGE INCLUDES: Different from other tripods, this tripod has three 1/4" threaded holes added to the bracket, which can meet the needs of external magic arms, mobile phones, monitors, etc. Package Include : Tripod*1, Smartphone Holder*1, Carry Bag*1, Alen Wrench*3, Maunual*1, Stainless Steel Foot Screw*3, Quick release plate*2（one is equipped on tripod, another is in carry bag）.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars best tripod/monopod ever
reviews.reviewText: it’s sturdy, has good weight, 2 plates for multiple cameras, it’s perfect. Use it everyday with no issues and it’s PERFECT

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best lightweight tripods you can buy.
reviews.reviewText: This Smallrig tripod is one of the best that I've purchased. It's lightweight, very strong and the ball head is absolutely great. It stays where you lock it. Cudo's to Smallrig. My first order arrived missing the mounting plates. Wrote to Amazon/Smallrig and within a few days they sent a 2nd tripod (no charge). I have used this tripod with my Nikon D4, d7000 and Z6II. Unless its very, very windy out there is no camera shake even with a big telephoto lens.. Well worth the price...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price, some issues.
reviews.reviewText: Versatile and sturdy. The product is good for the price and for those on a budget. Legs are easily adjustable and stable.The ball mount is about what I’d expect for the price,Can get jammed up sometimes.The screws for the legs tend to become very loose, making the legs flop around while walking. I usually have to retighten them all after every shoot.All the other features work well and the build quality is pretty good overall. I’d say it’s a good buy for those on a budget.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not a Professional, But I Like It
reviews.reviewText: I've used a few tripods in my life. I'm far from a professional, and nothing in the thousand dollar range or anything... But for under $100 this thing is pretty incredible.It FEELS sturdy. Like you can just feel that this thing is ready to work.The adjustments are easy and quick. And the arca plate is a nice change from what I've used in the past.The fact that this came with a cell phone mount too... It should have been the tripod I bought years ago.I added the Small rig fluid video head too, and I'm ready to go!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome little tripod!
reviews.reviewText: This little tripod is light weight, compact and looks good. Not to mention, it is from a company that is well established in the camera accessory industry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Lightweight Tripod
reviews.reviewText: I love this tripod. It's lightweight and easy to use. I have a lot of tripods and this one is my go-to. I do want to tell you though, that if you take it, take the allen wrench with you. Sometimes the legs and other items work their way loose. Keeping the allen wrench on hand to tighten them is important. It's not a deal breaker by any stretch but it does annoy me personally. For the price, it's a great product and comes with a lot of accessories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality I new to this gotta figure out if there’s an adapter to not use the arcs Swiss
reviews.reviewText: Very sturdy and stable. I have a different small rig and for some reason the screw on tbe top of the monopod stick is. It the same as the other. Keel.The head works great for portrait mode. Phone is iPhone 13promax max in a Smallrig cage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed with the Durability and Performance of SmallRig Tripod
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the SmallRig tripod with expectations of quality and reliability, as I have owned several SmallRig products in the past. Unfortunately, this tripod has been a letdown. Despite minimal usage over the past year and a half, it has failed to meet basic standards of sturdiness and functionality.One positive aspect is its height, which I found to be ideal for my needs. However, this is overshadowed by the significant stability issues. Every time I use it, I encounter problems; it doesn’t stand up properly and feels fragile. For a product that is not frequently used, I expected far better durability and performance.Based on my experience, I would advise potential buyers to consider other options. While it might look good on paper, the tripod fails to deliver in practical usage. It’s disheartening to see a reputable brand like SmallRig miss the mark on such a crucial aspect of their product.In conclusion, this tripod is not a wise investment. There are better options available that offer reliable stability and build quality.
